channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: At Davos, U.S. allies question a fraying world order
item.description: It was a volatile week for trans-Atlantic relations, marked by President Trump statements that unsettled global markets and strained ties with U.S. allies — on topics ranging from Greenland to Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
It was a volatile week for trans-Atlantic relations, marked by President Trump statements that unsettled global markets and strained ties with U.S. allies — on topics ranging from Greenland to Gaza.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: A Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged drug kingpin is arrested in Mexico
item.description: Ryan Wedding was among the FBI's top fugitives and faces charges related to drug trafficking and the killing of a federal witness. He reportedly turned himself in at the U.S. embassy in Mexico
item.content:encoded:
Ryan Wedding was among the FBI's top fugitives and faces charges related to drug trafficking and the killing of a federal witness. He reportedly turned himself in at the U.S. embassy in Mexico

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Vietnam leader To Lam consolidates power as country targets 10% growth
item.description: Lam, 68, pledged to accelerate economic growth and was reappointed unanimously by the 180-member Central Committee at the conclusion of the National Party Congress.
item.content:encoded:
Lam, 68, pledged to accelerate economic growth and was reappointed unanimously by the 180-member Central Committee at the conclusion of the National Party Congress.

(Image credit: Hoang Thong Nhat/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Millions of Americans brace for winter storm. And, Zelenskyy's warning for Europe
item.description: Millions of Americans are bracing for a massive, life-threatening winter storm this weekend. And, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivers a stark message to Europe at the World Economic Forum in Davos.
item.content:encoded:
Millions of Americans are bracing for a massive, life-threatening winter storm this weekend. And, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivers a stark message to Europe at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

(Image credit: Will Newton)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Palestinians say Jared Kushner's vision for Gaza erases what's left of their homes
item.description: Jared Kushner unveiled a vision of a futuristic cityscape for Gaza that includes skyscrapers and advanced industrial zones, but Palestinians fear his vision erases what remains of their homes.
item.content:encoded: Jared Kushner unveiled a vision of a futuristic cityscape for Gaza that includes skyscrapers and advanced industrial zones, but Palestinians fear his vision erases what remains of their homes.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy gives scorching critique of Europe in Davos speech
item.description: At Davos, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy warned Europe is divided and unprepared for a more dangerous world, urging unity and less reliance on the U.S.
item.content:encoded: At Davos, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy warned Europe is divided and unprepared for a more dangerous world, urging unity and less reliance on the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine discusses Zelenskyy's Davos speech
item.description: NPR's A Martinez asks William Taylor, a former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine, about his thoughts following President Zelenskyy's speech at Davos.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez asks William Taylor, a former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine, about his thoughts following President Zelenskyy's speech at Davos.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Dollars trickle into Venezuela's economy after first sales of country's oil by U.S.
item.description: The first sales of Venezuelan oil by the U.S. seem to have stabilized prices for now, but there are many questions about the long-term viability of U.S. control of the Venezuelan economy.
item.content:encoded: The first sales of Venezuelan oil by the U.S. seem to have stabilized prices for now, but there are many questions about the long-term viability of U.S. control of the Venezuelan economy.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Venezuela opens debate on an oil sector overhaul as Trump seeks role for US firms
item.description: Venezuela's legislature advanced a bill on Thursday to loosen state control over the country's vast oil sector, the first major overhaul since parts of the industry were nationalized in 2007.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuela's legislature advanced a bill on Thursday to loosen state control over the country's vast oil sector, the first major overhaul since parts of the industry were nationalized in 2007.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Greenland and the world order
item.description: Is there a deal between the U.S., Denmark and Greenland? Mary Louise Kelly and the team on NPR's national security podcast break it down.
item.content:encoded: Is there a deal between the U.S., Denmark and Greenland? Mary Louise Kelly and the team on NPR's national security podcast break it down.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly
